MajorClaims.MC1: large scale sports games make people focus on attractive contests instead of international disputes, and help them being proud of their nation
MajorClaims.MC2: it is clear that they not only constitute a tremendous appeal towards a peaceful society, but also guide the public demonstrations of national proudness

Claims.C1: world sports events strongly participate in eventually pulling back people towards friendship and peace
Claims.C2: it is clear that people can freely express their patriotic feelings during international sports events
Claims.C3: This has been true for centuries and will certainly not change in the foreseeable future

Premises.P1: during times of war, people living in badly affected countries can forget about the gloomy environment and maintain a link with the rest of the world by listening to international sports event
Premises.P2: when Irak was hardly struck by the Second Gulf War, its citizens tried to catch any incoming news about the FootballWorld Cup through their portable receivers
Premises.P3: international sports competitions encourage people and put pressure on them to come back, sooner or later, to a relative peaceful normality
Premises.P4: these sporting occasions are a good opportunity for people to be proud of their country
Premises.P5: when the Football World Cup was organised in South Africa, its citizens filled up the stadiums, cheered and waved national flags to support their national team on the field
Premises.P6: South African national and traditional songs were played in the streets throughout the night
Premises.P7: This example demonstrates how people might take numerous elements from their roots and history to proudly display them while supporting their team
